headline: 'Gutfeld!' on diversity quotas
subHeadline: 'Gutfeld!' welcomed guests Jamie Lissow and Walter Kirn

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Warning. Greg had an endoscopy earlier today and is still coming down from a strong anesthetic. We're not responsible for anything he says during the follow show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's true. I'm not lying.  So, it's an especially happy Friday for me because yes, I just had an endoscopy. That's when they shove a tiny camera down your throat to see how stuff's working. Everything seems OK. The best part is that videos ratings were still higher than CNN's. But thankfully, they didn't find anything scary except for Dana Perino's class ring. There's a few diamonds missing from it, but I'm hoping my proctologist will find those next week.  But in order to do that procedure, they put me on a drug that knocked me out. So, forgive me if I make less sense than Joe Biden, speaking without a teleprompter. But, at least I know what it's like to be Kat.   Anyway. Last night, a debate erupted over the Brooklyn Nets guard Kyrie Irving, who's refused the COVID vaccine. Now, I don't follow professional badminton. But this is now a big deal. Since New York City requires proof of the vax for entry into the arena where the Nets play. So, on Tuesday, the Nets said Irving won't play until he's vaxxed, but he isn't doing it. I mean, what would you do?

utterances.speaker: KYRIE IRVING, AMERICAN PROFESSIONAL BASKETBALL PLAYER, BROOKLYN NETS
utterances.sentences: What would you do? You know, if you felt uncomfortable going into the season, when you were promised that you will have exemptions, or that you didn't have to be forced to get the vaccine. I'm staying grounded in what I believe in. It's just as simple as that. It's not about being anti-vax, or about being, you know, on one side or the other. Like, it is just really about being true to what feels good for me. I chose to be unvaccinated. And that was my choice. And I would ask you all just to respect that choice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now, what's interesting about this story is in Irving's reasoned opinion, but how it affects people who hear it? It's now a pickup game of the shirts versus the skins. See what I did there? Check out the debate on this intriguing program. It features five panelists. One really, really hot guy, and it's on at 5:00 p.m., but I can't remember the name.

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CORRESPONDENT-AT-LARGE
utterances.sentences: Rules are rule.  This guy is wrecking his life right now fort no real reason and it's absolute stubbornness based on nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, you're mad at this guy.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I am mad at him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're mad at him --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Because he's not just hurt -- he's not just hurting himself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, but what I'm saying is you're being played. You're being played

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He's hurting everybody like Jesse who invested in Brooklyn Nets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're being played. You are being played. You are being

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You're being stubborn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I'm trying to explain.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You're being blunt-headed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can I finish my point? You are being manipulated to disagree with somebody. This is an artificial division and we shouldn't play into this.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I want Dana, dig in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is what the mandate did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, it's weird watching yourself on T.V. while you're on T.V.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don Lemon does that to double his viewership. Anyway, I fear that Geraldo missed my point that the anger he felt toward Irving was not caused by Irving at all. It's caused by the situation created by people in power in order to create conflict, to keep us at each other's throats, like Joy and Whoopi fighting over the last eclair in the green room.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.  The elites, they like sweets. The elites are trying to fight a proxy war with each other through the citizens, and unfortunately, it seems to be working. Irving was trying to focus on getting a shot in the neck, not getting a shot in the arm. But Geraldo felt genuine anger toward him. The same kind I feel towards Kilmeade when he won't return my swim trunks. Doesn't even own a pool.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But the anger is misplaced. Its fury, manufactured by the establishment who are scared to death of liability and therefore risk. But they're also terrified to you and me or me and Geraldo if we happen to ever agree, which is hard to do when you're looking at that moustache.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes. That thing's a whole different kind of two pointer. Little sports, Joe.   But if we all got along despite our political health or height differences, it makes it that much harder for the aristocracy to control you and for the media to make a buck.  The people in power lose power when we resist the traps that they set for us. We've seen now division is that gone through media narratives that aren't true, and politicians who need to target. CNN fostered the anti-police narrative and wove it into a racial conflict that is since mushrooms into a Stelter-sized monstrosity of lies and identity politics. Others who wish to pit the sexes against each other do so, because it makes careers in academia and jobs for people in human resources.  They do this with gays and straights, trans and gays, dogs and cats, "FOX AND FRIENDS".

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Conflict sells. That's why every good Bond film has a Bond villain. And it's why CNN, "The View", MSNBC, suck. While we push each other around in the streets, they're raking it in with their click bait.  If only we got along, their jobs would vanish faster than a story on Hunter's laptop, and the people's power would grow. But now, we're being pulled into new conflicts: vaxxed versus unvaxxed, masked versus no mask.  Once you see how it's being ginned up though, you see it everywhere. Take the NBA player. Seriously, why get mad over someone you don't even know who is making a decision for himself. I mean, unless it's something like talking loudly on a cell phone in a movie theatre, in that case, stabbed the jerk.  Don't stab the jerk. That's a joke. But other than that, just realize, it's CNN and Biden administration trolling you and us. Right now it's kind of clear that someone who is young, lean, and incredibly fit such as Kyrie and myself, does not have the same risk profile as someone with a pre-existing condition. Unless, unbeknownst to me, Kyrie once dated Kat. He poses no threat to Geraldo, or me, or our families. I don't know what that means. But we're living in a time of conformity. And when you don't conform, you're shunned like Jerrold Nadler skinny dipping at a public pool. So, whenever you feel yourself getting angry at someone else, and you're only given two choices, it's a binary prison of ideas. Remember, that it's a desired phenomenon created by a third party. It creates content for T.V.  producers, and it distracts the populace from the real bad -- that's going on. Like crime, mental illness, and my relentless IBS caused by swallowing class rings.  If we fight amongst ourselves, we can't fight them, and they can continue ignoring real injustice, and get rich off you along the way. So, mandates became just another tool to split us apart. But the media's argument that there has to be a deep seated hatred amongst Americans is much like Al Capone's vault. Once you crack it open, there is nothing really there. And once you see it, you can't unsee it. Much like when you see Geraldo shirtless.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Sadly, there is no vaccine for that.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: PERIOD!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guest. He's a successful comedian, and actor, which means, at one point in his career, he was also a successful waiter. Jamie Lissow Her last names Italian for talks to fast. "OUTNUMBERED" co-host Emily Compagno.   Oh, look at that. His novels are so delicious, they should be in a cookbook section. Up in the Air author Walter Kirn. She has got brains, she has got beauty, and if you feed her beans, she's gets a little toothy. Fox News contributor Kat Timpf. Walter, the problem with this COVID stuff is that we cannot discount the fact -- by the way, it's nice to see you.

utterances.speaker: WALTER KIRN, NOVELIST, LITERARY CRITIC
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've missed you.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Good to be here, man.

utterances.speaker: EMILY COMPAGNO, FOX NEWS CHANNEL CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Cute.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is not cute. Shut up, Emily. We cannot discount the fact that people when given the chance to feel righteous, you know, from flight attendants to T.V. anchors will take that shot, right? And that's what I feel like what we're seeing. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: When I was a kid, we used to read a short story in high school called, The Lottery. And it was about a small Protestant hometown in -- I think, Vermont, where every year, to make the crops grow, the farmers formed a circle, picked one person, and stone them to death.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, really.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: And so there's an ancient instinct in people to make a scapegoat, pay for all the difficulties of life, you know, in the thought that maybe, you know, it will bring back normalcy, if we sacrifice them. And today it's him. But, you know, I remember when Muhammad Ali wouldn't go to the Vietnam War  --

utterances.speaker: JAMIE LISSOW, ACTOR, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Professional athletes are people too. We treat them like a paid circus performers. Then, they come out, show they have a conscience, and that they don't need the applause and acclaim that we give them. And personally, he's made all the right decisions about his body, his whole life.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: He made it into the NBA.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: I think he's probably still making them, and that he's suddenly a moron is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true. The lottery, so you're saying that was a bad idea?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Well, not if you want the crops to grow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's exact --

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Some things take priority, Jamie. Long time since I've seen you as you've been living in -- where do you live now? Still in Fairbanks, Alaska?

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: Fairbanks, Alaska.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: That's right. Trying to get geographically is far away from where I would be successful.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you've done quite well for your (INAUDIBLE). You are successful in your failure?

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. What do you make of this whole story? Where do you stand or sit?

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: Can I say, first of all, I know you had the endoscopy this morning.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: And you're on some drugs. I wanted to apologize throughout the bad. I'm also on some painkillers, because this morning, I had access to some.  And still --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That might be the best joke I've ever heard. But then again, I'm really high, so what is the better?

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: I have told that joke before but no one can hear because I was in Alaska. I feel like -- I think Kyrie is brave.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: I think he's a -- he's a brave guy. And I think it's impressive because he is a rich guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: I think we could say he makes $400,000 a game.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: I think I saw, is that true?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: Like, for $4,000, I would take the anthrax vaccine. I really would. And you could say -- then, I was thinking like he could have gone the way like, you know, LeBron. I think Stephen Curry got the Johnson and Johnson.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: So, we could have just gone with that with they just released today that they're saying that Johnson and Johnson vaccine is just as effective - - is just having one of those little circular band aids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Good to see you, Jamie.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: It's good to see you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So much talent. Such a -- such an empty state.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: It's no --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know what I'm saying. Emily, what -- do you feel this debate could be easily settled if we just got rid of lawyers in the media, from the room --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Hey.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: I was just going to give --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're a (INAUDIBLE) in the media and a lawyer.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Well, I was going to say, but I feel like I shouldn't, now, you don't deserve it. But that, I don't think that disclaimer in the beginning impasses legal muster. Just saying. Look, here is -- here is what kills me about that. So, Kyrie actually said it best himself? And he said, what would you do? If you were told there would be exemptions -- exceptions, alternatives? Look at Andrew Wiggins from the warriors who applied for a religious exemption and he was denied. We were told that COVID negative tests would suffice for these athletes that chose not to get the vaccine. In fact, we were told that with the New York City, we were told that within the federal government, but that encroachment just keeps creeping. And so, Kyrie can stand to lose, yes, $15.5 million, which he will this season. That means he can stand to lose that if he is. But what about all of those Navy sailors that are being dishonor or discharged less than honorably, and they're losing their veterans benefits, they're losing their pension. These are hardworking Americans that have served our country that are losing everything that have mouths to feed because they have chosen to have autonomy over their body and made their own personal decision, religious or otherwise. But if it doesn't pass that arbitrary test according to some coach or some medical examiner at that moment --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Then, it hasn't been approved. So, that -- the mandate -- he is absolutely right. And the mandate is what is difficult to stomach. And everyone stepping up against them with whatever platform they have, we should applaud rather than condemn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's I don't -- there you go. By the way, I think if it's the team, it's the -- it's the edict from the -- from the government in New York that's forcing the team's hand, which is what we're seeing. We're seeing the government freelance their authoritarianism. So, that it's the company -- all the companies now going -- it's a company's choice to do that, and you work at the company. No, it's the government telling the company to do it by saying, you can't work here.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, and we've all just gone completely crazy because he watched that video and he says it's my choice. I'm asking you to respect my choice.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: He doesn't say boycott the NBA.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: He doesn't even say agree with me. He just -- you know, you watch that, hear someone say it's my choice, respect my choice. You think, oh, yes, OK.

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And you turn on the T.V. and people like, no. You know, then, he's like, we're going to talk about what a horrible person you are all night long, actually. And there's a certain point where it's just completely -- it's completely psychotic reaction.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Just someone to be like, it's my choice, you respect my choice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, it is the -- it is -- but, it's because we are forcing people in the prison of two ideas. There's a million ideas, but -- million stances between (INAUDIBLE) and hey. There is. I don't know why my hands are still up here.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: I like you, hi.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know what's going on (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: I took -- I took painkillers too. No, I'm not kidding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why don't you share?

utterances.speaker: KIRN
utterances.sentences: I threw my back out, because I tried to be stealth when I'm stoned.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Am I the only sober one here?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That's insulting to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know, it is insulting. It's like if you got him, you got to share them.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I agree. I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Unless you're -- unless you're like the crappy kind.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: A friend like Tramadol.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: Greg, on my painkillers, on the back of the bottle, it said, do not mix with alcohol. But I read that as, this are probably pretty good if you mix with alcohol.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Up next, diversity quotas get repealed when it's time to put a team on the field.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. They care about the color of your skin, unless you can throw the pigskin. Yes, when talking about football, diversity goes a wall. Campus Reform reporter Ophelie Jacobson recently spoke to students at the University of Florida. They have a university in Florida? And she learned that get ready to get your mind blown. Diversity is a very important thing on campus.

utterances.speaker: OPHELIE JACOBSON, REPORTER, CAMPUS REFORM
utterances.sentences: We are talking with college students about diversity quotas today. Do students support these quotas in the workplace and in the college admission's process? And will these students change their mind if we apply those same diversity quotas to the Florida Gators football team. Do you think diversity should be a factor in hiring decisions, and in college admissions processes?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Probably. They should probably have diversity quotas for like college admissions. And I think they already have quotas, though, but like, those are definitely a good thing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, I think it's an absolute necessity.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: As a first generation college student from a Hispanic household, it's very important.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely, there should be more diversity in basically every single field.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Great. But what about when it comes to your perennial powerhouse football team?

utterances.speaker: JACOBSON
utterances.sentences: What about diversity quotas on sports teams -- college sports teams? Do you guys think?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No, I think that should be skill-based.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely. Sometimes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I think we want to win.

utterances.speaker: JACOBSON
utterances.sentences: We were to apply that quota to the offensive lineup for the Florida Gators football team. This is what the lineup would look like.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: OK, and that's probably not what it looks like at all.

utterances.speaker: JACOBSON
utterances.sentences: This is what it looks like right now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: JACOBSON
utterances.sentences: How do you feel?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I feel like there's -- the prize is more skilled players.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I don't necessarily think that. It's a bad thing that these people are just better at the sports that they play.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I mean, definitely be different. When is the last time you saw a prominent Asian in football?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, true. Yes, put down that cello and start hitting the pads. Anyway, did the kids change their mind once they realize the double standard?

utterances.speaker: JACOBSON
utterances.sentences: Does this kind of change your mind about diversity quotas in other sectors?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If you're recruiting athletes based on their skill level, maybe you should admit students based on their scores and their like academic merit more so than diversity.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Skill always comes first. I don't necessarily think quotas are the way to go. I know they're unconstitutional. I know they're wrong.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, you want the best. It doesn't really matter what the person's race is. Who they are, whatever. Like (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And you could make a good argument for why? My reason for school would be the same for sports, basically. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know what you're thinking. That kid and the sailor hat is adorable. Get that young man, a pipe and a can of spinach. But also, deep down, no one cares about diversity if it means sacrificing success, which Jacobson cleverly exposed. Those students learned more in 10 minutes than they will in four years, which is -- all right, I'm going to stop there. We need to save time. Emily, like me, you were a cheerleader for the Raiders. I still on my skirt, by the way. What do you -- is this funny? This is great when it -- it's we realize it's all a farce.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Absolutely, it's amazing. And if people don't want to apply quotas to sports because they want to win, then why the hell are we applying it to the military, and the CIA, and the FBI? Remember those commercials?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: If people want there to be equity -- and true diversity and inclusion, which people do, then we have to invest in the opportunities and to preparing people for it. It's not about collecting people at the back end. It's about creating options at the front end, right? So, investing in school choice, eradicating the teachers unions and these ridiculous zoom calls, and everything else that chokeholds the opportunities for admissions and for things that people are just arbitrary assigning boxes and acceptances.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think you should just pick people randomly regardless of age, weight, gender.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I'm talking infants and grandmas in wheelchairs -- obese.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: That's like Dodgeball.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: And then, maybe like one randomly super athletic person. That, I would watch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. RSL, the Random Sports League.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I will watch. And you don't even know what sport you're playing until you get there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That I would watch. Then, I would maybe understand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know, I was going to -- you are at Campus Reform, right?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, I sure was.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I thought that they've come a long way since you did it.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Oh, because I did such a bad job that's why you hired me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: That reflects poorly on you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Jamie --

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What are -- do you have a -- on your writing staff for the shows that you work for, do you have pushed for diversity? Are you a racist?

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: I haven't been in a room for a while because of diversity. It's always pretty naturally diverse are the ones that I've been on. And you know, it's funny I watched the video that you just showed, and it's so weird, I don't know if it happened to the audience, but I couldn't hear a thing that the girl with the orange topless saying (INAUDIBLE). I don't know if I have like an audio problem or what's going on. You know -- you know --

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LISSOW
utterances.sentences: God, I hope she's old enough to make that joke. You know that's a point.

Through the woke-ster's de-modern math guilty of a white patriarchal pass, especially those pesky Arabic numerals. Arabic? Yes. Wow, I haven't encountered this much poppycock since I stumbled onto that nude beach for seniors. But if this change is adopted, the glass, the glasses would be mandatory. utterances.speaker: KIRN
